Speaker: olaf
Dialogue: Leif, let's do the deed before another night falls. The crew's near mutiny.

Speaker: leif ericson
Dialogue: Know this! The first man to turn will taste my steel in his guts.

Speaker: olaf
Dialogue: But we've surely gone far enough.

Speaker: ericson
Dialogue: That accursed box must be thrown off the edge of the world. We will go until we can go no more...

Speaker: lookout
Dialogue: ...Land ho.

Speaker: leif
Dialogue: By Odin's beard...

Speaker: ericson
Dialogue: Be quick, Witch. Let the deed be done.

Speaker: witch
Dialogue: Oh Loki, ancient one. Thy mischief dwell now in waters, base and bland. And in waves and sand thy magic forever sleep...

Speaker: olaf
Dialogue: Captain, you've discovered a new world. It is your right to name it.

Speaker: ericson
Dialogue: Leave that to the Italians. We're never coming back here. Never. This land is now cursed.

Speaker: charlie
Dialogue: Look at those clouds rollin' in, man. Freaky weather.

Speaker: stanley
Dialogue: Hey Charlie, can you go over these stats? We're supposed to have a complete report before lunch.

Speaker: charlie
Dialogue: Woah. Sorry Stanley, I just had my weave tightened and my head is killing me. Be a pal and take those over to Hinkleman, will ya?

Speaker: maggie
Dialogue: Hi guys. Did you have any luck with those concert tickets Stanley?

Speaker: stanley
Dialogue: I sure did. Friday night, just like you wanted.

Speaker: maggie
Dialogue: Oh, Stanley, that's wonderful.

Speaker: stanley
Dialogue: What time should I pick you up?

Speaker: maggie
Dialogue: Gee, I don't know. My best girlfriend just got into town and I know she'd love to go. Can we get an extra ticket for her?

Speaker: stanley
Dialogue: Well... uh, actually it's sold out. I was kinda lucky to get these.

Speaker: maggie
Dialogue: She's only going to be in town a couple of days and I just can't let her sit at home all alone. Are you sure there isn't something we can do?

Speaker: stanley
Dialogue: You know what? Here. You two go.

Speaker: maggie
Dialogue: Oh Stanley, I couldn't do that.

Speaker: stanley
Dialogue: No really. Go ahead. It's okay. I hate concerts anyway. All that, you know... music floating around.

Speaker: maggie
Dialogue: That is so sweet. Sheila's just going to love this.

Speaker: stanley
Dialogue: So maybe you and I can get together over the weekend?

Speaker: maggie
Dialogue: I'm not sure what's going on, but just give me a call. You know I like to be spontaneous.

Speaker: stanley
Dialogue: Oh, sure. Me too.

Speaker: maggie
Dialogue: Stanley Ipkiss, you are the nicest guy.

Speaker: charlie
Dialogue: That's it.

Speaker: stanley
Dialogue: What?

Speaker: charlie
Dialogue: The kiss of death. As soon as they use the "N" word it's all over.

Speaker: stanley
Dialogue: So maybe I am a nice guy. So what?

Speaker: charlie
Dialogue: You are a rug. I am talking astro-turf here. You're letting these women sharpen their cleats on you.

Speaker: stanley
Dialogue: Hey, I'm a gentleman. If they can't appreciate that, it's their problem.

Speaker: charlie
Dialogue: You spend too much time being "nice" to a girl, you'll wind up sittin' around listening to her complain about the son of a bitch she really loves.

Speaker: stanley
Dialogue: Charlie, you are a very sick puppy.

Speaker: charlie
Dialogue: Wake up, Stanley! These are the nineties. We're dealing with an entire generation of dysfunctional love junkies. You can't romance 'em. You gotta confuse 'em. It's the only thing that gets their attention.  Let me demonstrate. You see that girl over there?

Speaker: lisa
Dialogue: Oh, hi...

Speaker: charlie
Dialogue: Charlie.

Speaker: lisa
Dialogue: That's right. Sorry.

Speaker: charlie
Dialogue: Lisa, this may seem a little odd, but my friend over there and I were having this discusion and I thought maybe you could settle it for us.

Speaker: lisa
Dialogue: I'll help out if I can.

Speaker: charlie
Dialogue: Actually, I don't know... this is kind of a personal question.

Speaker: lisa
Dialogue: That's okay. Go ahead.

Speaker: charlie
Dialogue: Alright. Just for the sake of argument, if I wasn't a happily married man... am I the kind of guy you'd go out with?

Speaker: lisa
Dialogue: Oh, um... I don't know.  Well... yeah. I guess I would.

Speaker: charlie
Dialogue: Lisa, I have terrific news for you.

Speaker: lisa
Dialogue: What?

Speaker: charlie
Dialogue: I'm not married! Is this perfect or what? Listen, there's not a lot of women willing to come right out like that and admit they're attracted to a guy, but...

Speaker: charlie
Dialogue: Okay. Bad example. Some of these women got so much baggage they need an emotional sky cap. I'll tell you what Stanley, tonight I'm gonna take you on a love safari, deep into the darkest heart of the urban jungle.

Speaker: stanley
Dialogue: And where's that?

Speaker: charlie
Dialogue: The Monkey's Paw. Hottest new club in town. It's a guaranteed skirt alert and no dead beats allowed.

Speaker: stanley
Dialogue: So how are we gonna get in?

Speaker: charlie
Dialogue: Woah, do I detect a little self-image problem there, buddy? You just leave everything to me. This, my friend is going to be the perfect night on the town.

Speaker: charlie
Dialogue: Hold the phone. Killer at three o'clock.

Speaker: charlie
Dialogue: Oh my god... A perfect dime. The dame of dames. The Moby of my dick.

Speaker: stanley
Dialogue: Easy Charlie. You'll sprain your eyes.

Speaker: tina
Dialogue: Excuse me, where can I open a new account?

Speaker: charlie
Dialogue: You've come to the right place, ma'am. Just step right this way and pull up a chair...

Speaker: tina
Dialogue: Oh, I'm sorry. I'm a complete wreck. Will you hold this please?

Speaker: charlie
Dialogue: Here, let me take that for you.

Speaker: tina
Dialogue: Thanks.

Speaker: stanley
Dialogue: So, uh, what kind of account did you have in mind?

Speaker: tina
Dialogue: Well, I'm not sure exactly. I'm just terrible with things like that. That's an interesting tie Mr...?

Speaker: stanley
Dialogue: Ipkiss. Stanley Ipkiss...

Speaker: tina
Dialogue: Tina Carlyle. Pleased to meet you.

Speaker: stanley
Dialogue: The, uh... pleasure's all mine.

Speaker: tina
Dialogue: May I? I'm such a mess.

Speaker: stanley
Dialogue: Oh... of course.

Speaker: tina
Dialogue: As I was saying about that tie. It's like one of those, what do you call them, ink blot tests.

Speaker: stanley
Dialogue: A Rorschach test.

Speaker: tina
Dialogue: That's it. It looks like... um. A young woman riding bareback. You know, like a Lady Godiva or something.

Speaker: stanley
Dialogue: Really? I don't think I can...

Speaker: tina
Dialogue: Or... if that's not a horse it could be two lovers. A man and a woman. That would be the woman on top, of course.

Speaker: stanley
Dialogue: ...Of course.

Speaker: tina
Dialogue: What do you see, Mr. Ipkiss?

Speaker: stanley
Dialogue: I don't know. ...Bold colors. It's a power tie, y'know? They're supposed to make you feel... powerful.

Speaker: tina
Dialogue: Does it work?

Speaker: stanley
Dialogue: Sort of. It's just a tie. Now, about that account.

Speaker: dorian
Dialogue: That's it sweetheart. A little to the right.

Speaker: dorian
Dialogue: What do you think, Doctor?

Speaker: dorian
Dialogue: Can you pull it off?

Speaker: dorian
Dialogue: Yeah, well the meter's runnin' on this one. We got less than a week.

Speaker: dorian
Dialogue: There's plenty. And I'll be happy to invest your share.

Speaker: dorian
Dialogue: This isn't about the lousy couple hundred thou' that's sitting in that vault, Freeze. That's chump change.

Speaker: dorian
Dialogue: We gotta expand your horizons Doctor. Take a look.

Speaker: dorian
Dialogue: Leave him to me. You pull off this heist and I promise you, it'll be all tits and champagne from here on in.

Speaker: stanley
Dialogue: Hold it up right here, please.

Speaker: driver
Dialogue: Hold up?! No hold up! I keel you very well! I splatter your guts big time, Mr. Cowboy Man!

Speaker: charlie
Dialogue: No! No! He only wants you to stop the cab!

Speaker: driver
Dialogue: Hokay. Pardon you very much.

Speaker: charlie
Dialogue: It's alright, Stanley.

Speaker: stanley
Dialogue: I hate this town. I really hate this town.

Speaker: charlie
Dialogue: Why are you getting out here?

Speaker: stanley
Dialogue: I gotta pick up my car.

Speaker: charlie
Dialogue: Fine. Now don't forget. Ten o'clock at the Monkey's Paw. I've already got us lined up with a couple of authentic dimes.

Speaker: stanley
Dialogue: Charlie, please. The last time you said that you showed up with two lesbian mud-wrestlers.

Speaker: charlie
Dialogue: Well, I can't promise we'll get that lucky again... Later!

Speaker: stanley
Dialogue: ...Hello?

Speaker: irv
Dialogue: Hang on. Hong on. Don't get your panties in a twist.

Speaker: burt
Dialogue: Hey Irv, what the hell is this?

Speaker: irv
Dialogue: Ohh... I dunno. About seven hundred bucks.

Speaker: irv
Dialogue: Now what can I do for you, Bub?

Speaker: stanley
Dialogue: I'm here for the Civic.

Speaker: irv
Dialogue: Japanese car, right? Kind of a nasty pea soup green?

Speaker: stanley
Dialogue: Well, they call it Emeral Forest, actually...

Speaker: irv
Dialogue: Burt! Pea green Civic!

Speaker: burt
Dialogue: Green Civic... Green Civic. Oh yeah! Brake drums are still on order and I'm only halfway through rebuilding the trans.

Speaker: stanley
Dialogue: But I just brought it in for an oil change!

Speaker: irv
Dialogue: Yeah? Well you're lucky we caught those other problems before they caused some serious trouble.

Speaker: stanley
Dialogue: Alright. Alright. When will it be ready?

Speaker: irv
Dialogue: Come back tomorro...  Yeah, first thing next month. That's if we can get the parts.

Speaker: stanley
Dialogue: What am I going to do in the meantime? I can't afford to keep taking cabs all over town.

Speaker: irv
Dialogue: Oh, hell... we can take care of that!  And for you little buddy, only ten bucks a day.

Speaker: stanley
Dialogue: It's a classic.

Speaker: charlie
Dialogue: Hey, Stanley. Nice wheels. What is that, a Rolls Canardley?

Speaker: stanley
Dialogue: A what?

Speaker: charlie
Dialogue: You know, a Rolls Canardley. Rolls down one hill canardley roll up the next.

Speaker: stanley
Dialogue: We are not discussing the car, okay?

Speaker: charlie
Dialogue: Whatever you say, man.

Speaker: charlie
Dialogue: What do you think? Pretty terrific, huh? This place make Sodom and Gomorrah look like Mayberry.

Speaker: stanley
Dialogue: Hey, isn't that...

Speaker: charlie
Dialogue: Right. The wet dream from the bank.  Hold on... I think I see my future ex-wife.

Speaker: girls
Dialogue: Hey Charlie! Charlie!

Speaker: charlie
Dialogue: We're in luck. It's Barbie and Pebbles.

Speaker: stanley
Dialogue: Doesn't it bother you that all the women you know are named after cartoon characters?

Speaker: barbie
Dialogue: We've been waiting out here for hours. Can you get us in?

Speaker: charlie
Dialogue: No, problemo. Ladies, this is my pal Stanley Ipkiss.  Stanley's very influential in the banking business.

Speaker: charlie
Dialogue: Hey Bobby! Bobby, buddy. What's happening man?

Speaker: stanley
Dialogue: Forget it, Charlie. I refuse to stand here waiting to be judged by these power-mad steroid jockeys.

Speaker: charlie
Dialogue: How much cash you got on you?

Speaker: stanley
Dialogue: What?

Speaker: charlie
Dialogue: You heard me. How much you got?

Speaker: stanley
Dialogue: I dunno, fifty or sixty bucks.

Speaker: charlie
Dialogue: Hand it over.

Speaker: stanley
Dialogue: No way.

Speaker: charlie
Dialogue: Hey, I'll pay you back! I'm only carrying plastic. C'mon man, you want to stand out here all night?

Speaker: charlie
Dialogue: Hey Bobby!

Speaker: bobby
Dialogue: Charlie, how you doin' man? Long time no see.

Speaker: stanley
Dialogue: Hey, wait a minute! Charlie!

Speaker: stanley
Dialogue: Hey! Leggo... awk!

Speaker: dorian
Dialogue: Lose him.

Speaker: tina
Dialogue: Oh... Stanley. Hi.

Speaker: policeman
Dialogue: Hey, you! What are you doing down there?

Speaker: stanley
Dialogue: I was just looking for...  My mask.

Speaker: tina
Dialogue: Thanks Reno, you're the greatest.

Speaker: reno
Dialogue: G'night, doll.

Speaker: dorian
Dialogue: That was a great performance, baby. But not as great as the one you pulled off at the bank.

Speaker: tina
Dialogue: Yeah, well don't get used to it. I'm not going to start running cons for you again, Dorian. I'm a singer now and that's it.

Speaker: dorian
Dialogue: Oh, really? And you had such a red hot career before you latched on to me?

Speaker: tina
Dialogue: Who latched on to who?

Speaker: dorian
Dialogue: Get real, Tina. You'll do what I say or I'll drop you back where I found you, slingin' hash and dodgin' horny peterbuilt drivers.

Speaker: tina
Dialogue: Don't push me, Nicky. I might just take a walk I should have taken a long time ago.

Speaker: dorian
Dialogue: I love it when she gets pissed.

Speaker: tina
Dialogue: Nobody.

Speaker: dorian
Dialogue: That's right, baby. C'mere.

Speaker: tina
Dialogue: Sorry. I never get personal in front of the help.

Speaker: dorian
Dialogue: That broad kills me.

Speaker: dorian
Dialogue: C'mon Doctor, lighten up.  Here's to Edge City Bank. May it crack like an egg on Easter Sunday.

Speaker: officer
Dialogue: Okay, Mr. Ipkiss. Try to be a little more careful next time.

Speaker: stanley
Dialogue: Thanks Officer.

Speaker: voice
Dialogue: Hey, mister...

Speaker: death's head
Dialogue: You a cop or something?

Speaker: stanley
Dialogue: Uh... no. They just gave me a lift.

Speaker: death's head
Dialogue: A cop chauffeur? I never seen that before. How about you boys?

Speaker: stanley
Dialogue: Alright, you guys. It's been a tough night. I haven't got any money. I haven't got a car. All I have is this and you're welcome to it.

Speaker: death's head
Dialogue: Hey, man. You got us all wrong. We don't want any trouble. I was just going to ask you for the time. That's all. You got the time?

Speaker: stanley
Dialogue: Uh... yeah.

Speaker: death's head
Dialogue: See, I only wanted the time! Heh, he, heh...

Speaker: stanley
Dialogue: Actually, no.

Speaker: stanley
Dialogue: Are you done?

Speaker: stanley
Dialogue: I think I'll be going to bed now.

Speaker: stanley
Dialogue: Hello, Milo.

Speaker: stanley
Dialogue: Easy. This is the best part.

Speaker: stanley
Dialogue: Think I'm repressed, Milo?

Speaker: larry king
Dialogue: The book is "The Masks We Wear," by Dr. Arthur Neuman. Thank you Dr. Neuman.

Speaker: stanley
Dialogue: No thank you, Dr. Neuman.

Speaker: stanley
Dialogue: Hellllllllppppmmmmmmmeeeeeeeee...

Speaker: the mask
Dialogue: S-s-s-nazzy!

Speaker: mask
Dialogue: Easy lady! I was just killin' time!

Speaker: voice
Dialogue: Hey mister...

Speaker: mask
Dialogue: Why of course, Cubbie. I got all the time in the world!

Speaker: mask
Dialogue: London, Paris, Rome, standard, substandard and no standards at all! And for our English friends we have... Big Ben!

Speaker: mask
Dialogue: And for my next trick...

Speaker: irv
Dialogue: Now these are serious chili dogs.

Speaker: burt
Dialogue: I know. Here's the proof...  Aaah. Even tastier the second time around.

Speaker: irv
Dialogue: Hey Burt, pull on my finger.

Speaker: burt
Dialogue: No way, man.

Speaker: irv
Dialogue: No, really. Go ahead.

Speaker: burt
Dialogue: Irv, don't...

Speaker: irv
Dialogue: That, my friend is the sweet smell of success.

Speaker: burt
Dialogue: No style. I give it a five tops.

Speaker: irv
Dialogue: Okay, how about... Soprano.

Speaker: burt
Dialogue: Fine muscle control.

Speaker: irv
Dialogue: And now for my grand finale, THX... The audience is listening!

Speaker: irv
Dialogue: Hey, 40 watt... we're closed! Nobody's here.

Speaker: mask
Dialogue: Ah... but you're here.

Speaker: irv
Dialogue: What I mean is...

Speaker: irv
Dialogue: Nobody's here that wants to help you.

Speaker: mask
Dialogue: But I'm here to help you.

Speaker: mask
Dialogue: Sounds like you have a little exhaust problem there!

Speaker: stanley
Dialogue: A dream... It was only a dream.

Speaker: stanley
Dialogue: Can I help you?

Speaker: stanley
Dialogue: That's right.

Speaker: stanley
Dialogue: Really? I didn't hear a thing.

Speaker: stanley
Dialogue: That's... impossible!

Speaker: stanley
Dialogue: That's... a, possible. See, I have this inner ear problem.  Sometimes I can't hear a thing.

Speaker: kellaway
Dialogue: Is that a fact?

Speaker: stanley
Dialogue: What?

Speaker: kellaway
Dialogue: Forget it.

Speaker: stanley
Dialogue: Sure... thanks.

Speaker: kellaway
Dialogue: Look, Mrs. Peenman, you gotta admit your description is pretty tough to swallow.

Speaker: kellaway
Dialogue: Right.  A green head the size of a pumpkin, purple zoot suit and spats. That's a pretty serious fashion risk for any self-respecting second story man.

Speaker: officer
Dialogue: Lt., we just got an emergency call from a mechanic on 67th Street.

Speaker: kellaway
Dialogue: What?

Speaker: policeman
Dialogue: Some kind of assault and battery. Sound pretty bad.

Speaker: kellaway
Dialogue: Alright. Dont' worry Mrs. Peenman, we'll find this guy for you. Officer Deluca here has a few forms you'll have to fill out.

Speaker: stanley
Dialogue: Milo! Keys! Keys!

Speaker: stanley
Dialogue: Good boy.

Speaker: officer
Dialogue: We were able to get a description Lt., but it's pretty weird.

Speaker: kellaway
Dialogue: Let me guess... Big green head. Zoot suit.

Speaker: officer
Dialogue: How did you...

Speaker: kellway
Dialogue: Whoever this guy is, he's a world class twisto.

Speaker: peggy
Dialogue: Excuse me, Lt., I'm with the Evening Star. Can you tell me what happened here?

Speaker: kellaway
Dialogue: Sorry. Too early to comment.

Speaker: peggy
Dialogue: It looks like some kind of mob scare tactic.

Speaker: kellaway
Dialogue: I said no comment. Now break it up. This is a crime scene.

Speaker: charlie
Dialogue: What happened to you last night? The girls and I were looking all over for you.

Speaker: stanley
Dialogue: I uh, didn't feel so good. I decided to go home early.

Speaker: charlie
Dialogue: As a matter of fact, you don't look so good. You got to take better care of yourself, man.

Speaker: stanley
Dialogue: How was the club?

Speaker: charlie
Dialogue: Are you kidding? It was hotter than a pistol. Did you see the paper?

Speaker: stanley
Dialogue: No.

Speaker: charlie
Dialogue: Your girlfriend got a great review.

Speaker: dickey
Dialogue: Ipkiss! You're forty minutes late! Every time you do that you're robbing this bank of its time and money!

Speaker: stanley
Dialogue: Sorry, Mr. Dicky. It won't happen again.

Speaker: dickey
Dialogue: If you weren't so busy ogling girlie pictures you'd get some work done around here.

Speaker: charlie
Dialogue: Ah... She's a prospective client of Stanley's, sir.

Speaker: dickey
Dialogue: She is? Well... Next time she comes in see that you send her directly to my office.

Speaker: stanley
Dialogue: Yes sir, Mr. Dickey.

Speaker: charlie
Dialogue: Look at that little creep. If it wasn't for his daddy he'd be out somewhere shakin' down school kids for lunch money.

Speaker: stanley
Dialogue: You think she ever will come back, Charlie?

Speaker: charlie
Dialogue: Who knows? Forget about her, Stanley. A dame like that is always looking for the B.B.D. The bigger better deal. Ask her what her sign is and she'll say dollar.

Speaker: stanley
Dialogue: You don't know that. She's an artist. Maybe she's sensitive.

Speaker: charlie
Dialogue: Yeah. She can sense a guy's credit line at two hundred yards. Stanley, you need a girl you can depend on. Someone a little more down to earth... someone like...

Speaker: peggy
Dialogue: Excuse me, can you tell me where I can find Stanley Ipkiss?

Speaker: charlie
Dialogue: Like her! Someone like her.  Hel-lo there. May I be of some assistance?

Speaker: peggy
Dialogue: Stanley Ipkiss?

Speaker: stanley
Dialogue: Oh, hi. I already have a subscription, thanks.

Speaker: peggy
Dialogue: Oh no, actually I just wanted to ask you a few questions.

Speaker: stanley
Dialogue: Really? About what?

Speaker: peggy
Dialogue: Ripley Auto Finishing. You're a customer of theirs aren't you?

Speaker: stanley
Dialogue: I... uh. No. I think you must have made a mistake.

Speaker: peggy
Dialogue: Isn't this a form of theirs you filled out?

Speaker: stanley
Dialogue: Oh, that Ripley Auto. I guess I have stopped in there once or twice, Miss... what did you say your name was?

Speaker: peggy
Dialogue: Peggy Brandt.

Speaker: stanley
Dialogue: Wait a minute... Peggy Brandt of "Ask Peggy"?

Speaker: peggy
Dialogue: That's right.

Speaker: stanley
Dialogue: You printed my letter last year, remember? "Nice Guys Finish Last."

Speaker: peggy
Dialogue: You're Mr. Nice Guy? Stanley do you realize how much mail we got about that letter? There's hundreds of women out there who are looking for a man just like you.

Speaker: stanley
Dialogue: Are you serious?

Speaker: peggy
Dialogue: Of course. DO you know how hard it is to find a decent man in this town? Most of them think monogamy is some kind of wood.

Speaker: stanley
Dialogue: Why are you covering this story?

Speaker: peggy
Dialogue: They cut my salary. I just can't make it by on "Dear Peggy" anymore. The truth is, I want to be a real reporter and if I can break this story I know they'll let me.  Look Stanley, I know Ripley Auto is a crooked operation. They may even have had ties to the Mob. I'm not out to get you. I just want the truth.

Speaker: stanley
Dialogue: I wish I knew the truth, Peggy. I really do.

Speaker: dorian
Dialogue: Good afternoon, Councilman Snell. Nice of you to drop by.

Speaker: snell
Dialogue: Cut the crap. Dorian. What's so important that I had to come here in person?

Speaker: dorian
Dialogue: I got a little job for you, Tom. I want you to pull the Swede's gambling license.

Speaker: snell
Dialogue: That's impossible. He was approved six months ago.

Speaker: dorian
Dialogue: Pull a few strings. Find something in the fine print. I don't care how you do it, but do it. You owe me.

Speaker: snell
Dialogue: I owe you nothing, you little piece of shit. I got your liquor license when nobody else would touch...

Speaker: dorian
Dialogue: That's pretty. What is that, a carnation?

Speaker: snell
Dialogue: No... please. I can do it. I can make it happen.

Speaker: dorian
Dialogue: That's smart. You're a very smart man. Now pull yourself together. Look at you.

Speaker: tina
Dialogue: Or it could be two lovers. That would be the woman on top, of course...

Speaker: charlie
Dialogue: Forget her, Stanley. Ask her what her sign is and she'll say dollar.

Speaker: dickey
Dialogue: Every time you're late Ipkiss, you're robbing this bank!

Speaker: tina
Dialogue: Hey, are you okay.

Speaker: stanley
Dialogue: I am now. C'mere, baby.

Speaker: tina
Dialogue: Oh, Stanley!

Speaker: stanley
Dialogue: Tina?

Speaker: stanley
Dialogue: No...

Speaker: the mask
Dialogue: Stanley... Stanley.

Speaker: stanley
Dialogue: Just... one... last... time.

Speaker: mask
Dialogue: I gotta be me! I just gotta be me!

Speaker: mask
Dialogue: Oooooh Bay-bee. I knoooooows what you likah!

Speaker: mask
Dialogue: The G.Q. look?... Naw.

Speaker: sweet eddy
Dialogue: Another five minutes.

Speaker: dorian
Dialogue: Nice work, Freeze. You boy are on your own now. I've got to make sure I'm seen downstairs.

Speaker: sweet eddy
Dialogue: Nothing! I didn't do nothing!

Speaker: freeze
Dialogue: C'mon! You keep that motor runnin'!

Speaker: mask
Dialogue: Sorry, fellas. Waste not want not!

Speaker: the mask
Dialogue: Ah... my public!

Speaker: bobby
Dialogue: Er, uh... Are you on the list?

Speaker: the mask
Dialogue: No, but I believe my friends are.  Jackson, Lincoln and Roosevelt.

Speaker: tina
Dialogue: There's all kinds of men In this old world That seek the affections Of a beautiful girl.

Speaker: dorian
Dialogue: What the hell are you doing here?

Speaker: eddy
Dialogue: We got trouble. You better come upstairs.

Speaker: tina
Dialogue: Don't want to see too fanatic But dollar signs are so romantic I want a love That's deep and real Just with a man that's got...  Checks ap-peaaal.

Speaker: the mask
Dialogue: Let's rock this joint!

Speaker: the mask
Dialogue: S-s-s-smokin!

Speaker: dorian
Dialogue: What the hell happened to you?

Speaker: freeze
Dialogue: I'll be okay. Nobody puts the chill on Freeze.

Speaker: dorian
Dialogue: Where's the money?

Speaker: freeze
Dialogue: Deal went south, Bro'. Someone else hit the place before we did.

Speaker: dorian
Dialogue: Who?

Speaker: freeze
Dialogue: Don't know. Dude looked like a freakin' goblin or something. Next thing we know there's cops all over us, man.

Speaker: dorian
Dialogue: Where's Chun Woo?

Speaker: freeze
Dialogue: Takin' a dirt nap. It was bad, man. Real bad.  I need a smoke.

Speaker: dorian
Dialogue: Yeah... sure.

Speaker: eddy
Dialogue: That's him... That's the guy!

Speaker: dorian
Dialogue: Come on!

Speaker: dorian
Dialogue: Clear the club. Now!

Speaker: the mask
Dialogue: Gee willickers! Does this mean we won't make the Star Search finals?

Speaker: dorian
Dialogue: This means you won't make it out of this club alive if you don't tell me where my money is.

Speaker: the mask
Dialogue: Okay...

Speaker: dorian
Dialogue: Now cut that out!  Ventilate this goon!

Speaker: mask
Dialogue: Ak... you got me Pahdnuh.

Speaker: kellaway
Dialogue: Drop it, Tyrel!

Speaker: dorian
Dialogue: Hello, Kellaway. You got a warrant or did you just drop by for a night cap?

Speaker: kellaway
Dialogue: I got probable cause. A couple of your boys were spotted knocking over Edge City Bank.

Speaker: dorian
Dialogue: Easy, junior. You're givin' me a woodey.

Speaker: kellway
Dialogue: One of them was wearin' some kind of big green mask.

Speaker: dorian
Dialogue: For once you're on the right track, but that's not one of my men. Maybe you ought to try a little actual police work instead of this harassment bullshit.

Speaker: kellaway
Dialogue: This isn't harassment. You want to see some harassment?  Search the place, boys.

Speaker: dorian
Dialogue: Ever wonder why you didn't make Captain, asshole? I got friends so high up they'd give you a nose bleed.

Speaker: kellaway
Dialogue: Well what d'ya know? I guess they gave you one too.

Speaker: dorian
Dialogue: You're a dead man.

Speaker: officer
Dialogue: Lt., we got a stiff upstairs. One of the guys from the heist.

Speaker: kellaway
Dialogue: Better call that high-priced lawyer of yours, Tyrel. You're comin' downtown.

Speaker: dorian
Dialogue: I'll be back on the streets before sunrise and you know it.

Speaker: kellaway
Dialogue: Then just think of this as the city's way of showing you a little hospitality.  I'll stop by to tuck you in myself.

Speaker: kellaway
Dialogue: You're on your own, boys.

Speaker: cop
Dialogue: Don't worry, Lt. If he's in there, well get him.

Speaker: kellaway
Dialogue: And if he's not, I got a feeling I know where to find him.

Speaker: stanley
Dialogue: Oh my god!

Speaker: stanley
Dialogue: All right, I'm coming!

Speaker: stanley
Dialogue: Lieutenant, what a surprise! What can I do for you?

Speaker: stanley
Dialogue: I've got to get ready for work.

Speaker: stanley
Dialogue: Here... mostly. Is something wrong?

Speaker: stanley
Dialogue: Mask -- who?

Speaker: stanley
Dialogue: Milo. No!  Okay, so I went out on the town last night. A guy's got to have a little fun.

Speaker: stanley
Dialogue: Naw, I just took 'em with me in case I didn't make it home. I don't know about you, Lieutenant. But I've got a pretty good track record with the ladies.

Speaker: stanley
Dialogue: What?

Speaker: kellaway
Dialogue: Bullshit. I hate the smell of bullshit. Don't even think about leaving town, Ipkiss. I'll be in touch.

Speaker: stanley
Dialogue: What are we gonna do, Milo? What are we gonna do?

Speaker: deputy oliveras
Dialogue: I don't know, boss. That's one helluva rubber mask.

Speaker: deputy oliveras
Dialogue: We got fingerprints on some of the currency, but nothing matches Tyrel's men. Looks like this guy beat 'em to the punch.

Speaker: deputy oliveras
Dialogue: You figure it was an inside job?

Speaker: dorian
Dialogue: A fifty thousand dollar reward to the man who finds this "Mask" character before the cops do. Get the word out to every street hustler and low life in this town.  I want him here. In my office. Alive. By tomorrow! Now get going!

Speaker: dorian
Dialogue: What are you looking at?

Speaker: tina
Dialogue: You. You're losing it Dorian.

Speaker: dorian
Dialogue: I'm losing nothing. Except maybe some extra baggage I don't need around here.

Speaker: tina
Dialogue: What's that supposed to mean?

Speaker: dorian
Dialogue: You weren't putting up much of a fight when that green goon kissed you last night.

Speaker: tina
Dialogue: C'mon, did it look to you like I had a choice?

Speaker: dorian
Dialogue: Maybe you did and maybe you didn't, but I know this, one day real soon I'm gonna run this town and when I do there's gonna be payback for anyone who crossed me.  I mean anyone.

Speaker: stanley
Dialogue: Back off Monkey-Boy, before I tell your daddy how you're running this branch like it's your own personal piggy bank! If the I.R.S. saw some of those files we could arrange a little vacation for you at Club Fed!

Speaker: charlie
Dialogue: Woah! What side of who's bed did you wake up on?

Speaker: stanley
Dialogue: I'm not sure.  I haven't exactly been myself lately.

Speaker: charlie
Dialogue: Yeah, well you look like you could use a little R and R there buddy... and as a matter of fact I've got just the ticket. Or should I say tickets?

Speaker: stanley
Dialogue: I'm afraid to ask.

Speaker: charlie
Dialogue: Saturday night. Grand opening of the Valhalla Casino. Serious skirt alert. Everybody who's anybody will be there. What do you say?

Speaker: stanely
Dialogue: I don't know Charlie, I...

Speaker: stanley
Dialogue: Tina... What are you doing here?

Speaker: tina
Dialogue: I heard about the robbery. I guess I just wanted to make sure you were okay.

Speaker: stanley
Dialogue: Oh, don't worry about me.  I'm fine.

Speaker: tina
Dialogue: Are you sure? You look a little...

Speaker: stanley
Dialogue: I'm just having a little trouble sleeping is all.  I guess you won't want to open that account after all this...

Speaker: tina
Dialogue: I'm not so sure I'll have much to open an account with anymore.

Speaker: stanley
Dialogue: What about the nightclub? I thought you were doing great.

Speaker: tina
Dialogue: I don't know how much longer I can stay there Stanley. Things are getting a little intense.

Speaker: stanley
Dialogue: Well, there must be plenty of other places you could sing. Maybe even get a record deal...

Speaker: tina
Dialogue: I wish it was that easy. There's thousands of girls out there just like me who...

Speaker: stanley
Dialogue: Not just like you. You've got a voice like... like an angel.

Speaker: tina
Dialogue: An angel huh? That's the first time I've heard that one.

Speaker: stanley
Dialogue: No, I mean it. You really do.

Speaker: tina
Dialogue: I can vamp my way through a tune. But that's not really singing.

Speaker: stanley
Dialogue: What is it with you, Tina? Why don't you believe in yourself?

Speaker: tina
Dialogue: I guess I've just heard a lot of promises from a lot of guys. In the end they all wanted the same thing and it wasn't a song.

Speaker: stanley
Dialogue: So maybe you've been singing for the wrong guys.

Speaker: tina
Dialogue: I'm not so sure there's any other kind. Not for me, anyway.  Well, I'm glad nobody got hurt.

Speaker: stanley
Dialogue: Yeah.

Speaker: tina
Dialogue: What about this guy, the Mask? Do the cops have a line on him?

Speaker: stanley
Dialogue: I'm not sure. Why are you interested?

Speaker: tina
Dialogue: Promise you won't say anything?

Speaker: stanley
Dialogue: Sure.

Speaker: tina
Dialogue: He came to the club last night and he was just so... well, different. I haven't been able to get him off my mind.

Speaker: stanley
Dialogue: Really? They say he's pretty weird looking.

Speaker: tina
Dialogue: Yeah. He's ugly... but he's kinda cool... y'know, like Mick Jagger.

Speaker: stanley
Dialogue: You really think so?

Speaker: tina
Dialogue: Yeah. If you hear anything about him, would you call me at the club?

Speaker: stanley
Dialogue: Actually... I sort of know the guy.

Speaker: tina
Dialogue: What?

Speaker: stanley
Dialogue: The Mask. We're - old college buddies him and I.

Speaker: tina
Dialogue: Are you serious?

Speaker: stanley
Dialogue: Oh yeah. To tell you the truth, I'm sorta covering for him on this bank thing. He's not such a bad guy, really. He just gets a little carried away.

Speaker: tina
Dialogue: I'll say. Do you think you could give him a message?

Speaker: stanley
Dialogue: I suppose so.

Speaker: tina
Dialogue: Tell him I want to see him again

Speaker: stanley
Dialogue: When? I mean, I'd need to tell him exactly.

Speaker: tina
Dialogue: How about seven o'clock tonight at Peninsula Park.

Speaker: stanley
Dialogue: I'll be... I mean, I'll make sure he's there.

Speaker: landlord
Dialogue: Sorry, doll. I had the locks changed this afternoon.

Speaker: peggy
Dialogue: You what? You can't do that!

Speaker: landlord
Dialogue: You've known we're going condo for six months, Peggy. I can't stall the owner a minute longer. Either you pony up the downpayment or you're out.

Speaker: peggy
Dialogue: Just a couple more days, Phil. The paper's ready to give me a full time job.

Speaker: landlord
Dialogue: I've heard that one before.

Speaker: peggy
Dialogue: C'mon, at least let me get a few of my things.

Speaker: landlord
Dialogue: Don't make me regret this. We get a certified check by noon tomorrow or a Sheriff will escort you out of here.

Speaker: peggy
Dialogue: Thanks Phil. You're a sweetheart.

Speaker: the figure
Dialogue: I heard you were lookin' for a story.

Speaker: peggy
Dialogue: Who... Who are you?

Speaker: the figure
Dialogue: Just a guy with a little information lookin' to make a buck. But maybe I heard wrong. You don't look like much of a reporter to me.

Speaker: peggy
Dialogue: You give me something worth printing and I'll get you your money. What's this about?

Speaker: figure
Dialogue: The guy they call the Mask and why Dorian Tyrel's willing to pay fifty large to get him.

Speaker: peggy
Dialogue: How do I find this Tyrel?

Speaker: figure
Dialogue: Careful, sweet meat. You break this story and he just might find you.

Speaker: swede
Dialogue: Dorian... thanks for coming by, kid.

Speaker: dorian
Dialogue: My pleasure, Swede. It's been too long. I was worried you were still pissed about that little thing with Harry the Hat.

Speaker: swede
Dialogue: That? It was nothing. He was a pain in my ass anyway. Here, sit down, sit down.

Speaker: dorian
Dialogue: Congratulations on the new casino.

Speaker: swede
Dialogue: Thanks, but it might be a little early to celebrate. As a matter of fact that's why I asked you to stop by.

Speaker: dorian
Dialogue: Is that right?

Speaker: swede
Dialogue: Here... have a little something to eat. That's Svenska meatballs, kid. The real thing.

Speaker: dorian
Dialogue: Thanks.

Speaker: swede
Dialogue: So, I tell you Dorian, it's a terrible shame. I put all my hard work into this beautiful casino and what do you think? All the sudden I got all kinda problems with the city. Big problems. The whole deal could fold.

Speaker: dorian
Dialogue: Maybe I can help you out. I'm expecting to come into a little investment capital shortly. If worse comes to worse and you really need to bail out...

Speaker: swede
Dialogue: What a sweet guy. Isn't this guy a sweetheart? Thanks for the offer Dorian, but I think maybe I can solve this myself.

Speaker: dorian
Dialogue: Is that right?

Speaker: swede
Dialogue: That's right. You know that Councilman you got in your pocket?

Speaker: dorian
Dialogue: Sure, Swede. Take it easy.

Speaker: swede
Dialogue: Good. Now get out of my sight.

Speaker: swede
Dialogue: Oh Dorian, here's a couple tickets to my grand opening. Stop by. And try to dress up nice. It's good for business.

Speaker: stanley
Dialogue: Look, you're the big expert on masks, right? Well, I've got an emergency here!

Speaker: stanely
Dialogue: I've got a date with the girl of my dreams, only she doesn't know it's me...

Speaker: stanley
Dialogue: I found it... or it found me. I'm not sure. The problem is it's ruining my life!

Speaker: stanley
Dialogue: Yes!

Speaker: stanely
Dialogue: But your book says masks...

Speaker: stanely
Dialogue: Yeah, well this one works in reverse.

Speaker: stanley
Dialogue: It's not a delusion! Alright, I'll prove it to you if I have to, but I won't be responsible for the consequences.

Speaker: stanley
Dialogue: Last chance to hide all dangerous objects.

Speaker: stanley
Dialogue: Whooooooooaaaaa...

Speaker: stanley
Dialogue: It didn't work?

Speaker: stanley
Dialogue: It worked last night. And the night before. Maybe it only works at night... What kind of mask did you say this was.

Speaker: stanley
Dialogue: What if he banished him... into a mask?

Speaker: stanley
Dialogue: But what should I do about my date?

Speaker: stanley
Dialogue: You know. Tonight. The park. Tina. Do I go as myself of the Mask?

Speaker: tina
Dialogue: Stanley, what are you doing here?

Speaker: stanley
Dialogue: Oh, Tina... Hi. You're early.

Speaker: tina
Dialogue: A little.

Speaker: stanley
Dialogue: I just... wanted to make sure you two got together okay.

Speaker: tina
Dialogue: That's nice.  You know, I hardly ever stop by here. It's hard to believe it was just a garbage heap.

Speaker: stanley
Dialogue: It's always beautiful at sunset. Those methane emissions really pick up the colors.

Speaker: tina
Dialogue: Wow. They really do. All those pinks and greens.

Speaker: stanley
Dialogue: Well... I'm sure my cousin will be along any minute. He never shows up anywhere 'till after sundown. He's sort of strange that way.  I guess I'll get going.

Speaker: tina
Dialogue: No, Stanley. Stay for a second. I was thinking about what you said and I, uh, I want you to know I appreciate it. Maybe you're right. If I believed in myself a little more I wouldn't rely on guys like Dorian.

Speaker: stanley
Dialogue: Dorian... You mean Dorian Tyrel?

Speaker: tina
Dialogue: Yeah. He's sort of my manager.

Speaker: stanley
Dialogue: Tina, you've got to be careful of that guy. He's a dangerous criminal.

Speaker: tina
Dialogue: You really mean that, don't you?

Speaker: stanley
Dialogue: Absolutely. You ought to hear the stories...

Speaker: tina
Dialogue: No, I mean, you're really worried about me. That's... real sweet, Stanley.

Speaker: stanley
Dialogue: C'mon, Tina this is serious. How involved are you with this guy?

Speaker: tina
Dialogue: I can take care of myself, Stanley. I always have.

Speaker: stanley
Dialogue: Oh, really? People close to Tyrel have a nasty habit of turning up dead, or haven't you noticed?

Speaker: tina
Dialogue: Look, this may sound a little cold but I do what I have to do to get by, okay? I'm nobody in this town without Dorian.

Speaker: stanley
Dialogue: And who are you with him Tina? I'm not exactly sure who I am anymore but at least I'm trying to find out. If you really had any faith in yourself, you wouldn't be hanging on to some kind of free ride.

Speaker: tina
Dialogue: Stanley... wait!

Speaker: the mask
Dialogue: Cher! Ce moi! Je'taime, Je' taime, Je any old tame! At last we are together mon petite bon bon!

Speaker: kellaway
Dialogue: This is Kellaway. I need back up and I need it now! Every available man down to Peninsula Park.

Speaker: murray
Dialogue: Looks like it's gonna be a long night. My wife is gonna kill me.

Speaker: peggy
Dialogue: What is it, Murray?

Speaker: murray
Dialogue: The cops got your pal Ipkiss staked out at Peninsula Park. We just picked it up over the police band.

Speaker: peggy
Dialogue: Let me cover it, Murray! You go on home to Claire.

Speaker: murray
Dialogue: I don't know, Peggy. Ramsey said...

Speaker: peggy
Dialogue: I'll take care of Ramsey. Thanks a million. I owe you one.

Speaker: the mask
Dialogue: Our love is like a red red rose, and I'm feeling so thorny already, I'd like to nip you in the bud!

Speaker: kellaway
Dialogue: Freeze!

Speaker: the mask
Dialogue: But eu 'tol me 'oo freeze!

Speaker: kellaway
Dialogue: Alright, alright. Unfreeze! You're under arrest!

Speaker: the mask
Dialogue: Under arrest! My god! The Law! I knew I'd forgotten something!  I was so young! So foolish! So full of life!

Speaker: kellaway
Dialogue: Sorry, son. That's not my department. Search him!

Speaker: doyle
Dialogue: Comb - Flintstones vitamins - Sousaphone - Bazooka -  picture of Kellaway's wife...

Speaker: kellaway
Dialogue: What the --?  Margaret!

Speaker: kellaway
Dialogue: You son of a bitch -- !

Speaker: kellaway
Dialogue: Get him!

Speaker: bullhorn voice
Dialogue: It's all over! Put your hands over your head or we'll open fire.

Speaker: female cop
Dialogue: They rave about Sloppy Joe - the Latin lothario - but Havana - has a new sensation.

Speaker: doyle
Dialogue: Hey, he's not bad.

Speaker: kellaway
Dialogue: You go out there and I'll blow your brains out!

Speaker: kellaway
Dialogue: Halt! Halt or we'll shoot!

Speaker: peggy
Dialogue: Stanley! Get in!

Speaker: stanley
Dialogue: Thanks. Where are we going?

Speaker: peggy
Dialogue: Someplace where we'll be safe.

Speaker: peggy
Dialogue: I saw it. I saw the whole thing. What's happening to you, Stanley?

Speaker: stanley
Dialogue: It's crazy... I've lost all control. When I put on this mask I can do anything... be anything, but it's ruining my life.

Speaker: peggy
Dialogue: Stanley, I don't know what's happening to you, but I do know this. That letter you sent my column was from a guy with more guts and heart than any of the creeps I've met in Edge City. Whatever this mask is, you don't need it. You... Stanley Ipkiss, are already all you ever need to be.

Speaker: stanley
Dialogue: Gosh, Peggy. Do you really mean that?

Speaker: peggy
Dialogue: Actually... no.

Speaker: stanley
Dialogue: What?

Speaker: peggy
Dialogue: What took you guys so long? I've been vamping here for twenty minutes.

Speaker: dorian
Dialogue: This is him?

Speaker: peggy
Dialogue: You have the fifty thou?

Speaker: stanley
Dialogue: Peggy, what are you doing?

Speaker: peggy
Dialogue: Sorry, Stanley. You really are a great guy, but I just can't lose my condo. You know how hard it is to find an apartment in this city.

Speaker: dorian
Dialogue: Okay Ipkiss. Where's the money from the heist?

Speaker: stanley
Dialogue: My aparment. It's in my apartment!

Speaker: dorian
Dialogue: Thanks. Now I believe you have a pressing engagement.

Speaker: peggy
Dialogue: Hey, you said you wouldn't hurt him!

Speaker: dorian
Dialogue: You're right. Easy boys. One thing at a time. Tell me about this mask, Ipkiss. How does it work?

Speaker: stanley
Dialogue: I don't know... You just put it on!

Speaker: sweet eddy
Dialogue: Better be careful, boss.

Speaker: dorian
Dialogue: What a rush.

Speaker: sweet eddy
Dialogue: Whoa, boss... are you okay?

Speaker: sweet eddy
Dialogue: But what about him?

Speaker: peggy
Dialogue: Ah... excuse me. If you don't mind, I'll just take my money and be going. You guys make yourselves at home.

Speaker: peggy
Dialogue: Thanks, anyway. That wasn't part of the deal.

Speaker: peggy
Dialogue: Back off Freakazoid. I wasn't born yesterday.

Speaker: sweet eddy
Dialogue: What do we do with Ipkiss?

Speaker: sweet eddy
Dialogue: Yeah, Dorian?

Speaker: thug
Dialogue: That money better be where you said it was, Ipkiss or you can Ipkiss your ass goodbye.

Speaker: doyle
Dialogue: The SWAT team got an offer to open for Wayne Newton.

Speaker: doyle
Dialogue: C'mon Lieutenant, it wasn't your fault. Something will turn up.

Speaker: stanley
Dialogue: I can explain everything...

Speaker: doyle
Dialogue: Don't bother.

Speaker: stanley
Dialogue: You've got to listen to me!

Speaker: stanley
Dialogue: Go find yourself a new home, Milo. It looks like I'm going to be here for a long long time...

Speaker: guard
Dialogue: Wake up. You gotta visitor.

Speaker: stanley
Dialogue: About time you found me a lawyer...  ...Tina?

Speaker: tina
Dialogue: Hello, Stanley.

Speaker: stanley
Dialogue: What's wrong? Your boyfriend kick you out for not delivering me on schedule?

Speaker: tina
Dialogue: Is that what you think - that I set you up?

Speaker: stanley
Dialogue: I don't know. But I've got plenty of time to figure it out.

Speaker: tina
Dialogue: You're just going to have to trust me on this.

Speaker: stanley
Dialogue: Now is not the best time for me on trusting women.

Speaker: tina
Dialogue: I ran out on Dorian last night, Stanley. I just came to tell you I'm sorry. Sorry about everything.

Speaker: stanley
Dialogue: You ran out on him?

Speaker: tina
Dialogue: That magic mask of yours turned him into some kind of monster...

Speaker: stanley
Dialogue: He wasn't exactly Mother Theresa in the first place.

Speaker: tina
Dialogue: He's going to the casino opening tonight and he's planning to do something terrible.

Speaker: stanley
Dialogue: A real change of pace for him.

Speaker: tina
Dialogue: Half this town will be there Stanley. I tried to tell the cops, but they wouldn't listen to me.

Speaker: stanley
Dialogue: As long as he's got the mask, there's nothing they can do to stop him anyway. There's nothing anyone can do.

Speaker: tina
Dialogue: There must be some way. How does it work?

Speaker: stanley
Dialogue: It's like it brings you innermost desires to life. If deep down inside you're a little repressed and... a hopeless romantic, you become sort of a love-crazy wild man.

Speaker: tina
Dialogue: And if you've got a black heart?

Speaker: stanley
Dialogue: Then the world's going to be a very dark place. And if I were you, I'd get out of town. Fast.

Speaker: tina
Dialogue: Thanks.

Speaker: stanley
Dialogue: For what?

Speaker: tina
Dialogue: Lots of things. For really believing in me when I couldn't. For sharing a sunset with me. For being the first guy to treat me like I was a person instead of a slab of meat.  And for being any kind of romantic. Even a hopeless one.

Speaker: stanley
Dialogue: You're welcome.

Speaker: tina
Dialogue: You know, that night at the club I knew I met someone special. Someone like nobody I'd ever met before.

Speaker: stanley
Dialogue: The Mask.

Speaker: tina
Dialogue: No... the guy that was inside the Mask all the time. You. Stanley Ip -

Speaker: tina
Dialogue: I've got to disappear for awhile Stanley. I'm not sure where I'll go but I'll let you know as soon as I can.

Speaker: stanley
Dialogue: Hey! A girl's being kidnapped out there! Do something!

Speaker: dorian
Dialogue: I was gettin' all worried about you.

Speaker: tina
Dialogue: I just went out for a little while Dorian.

Speaker: dorian
Dialogue: Looks like maybe a long little while, right baby?

Speaker: dorian
Dialogue: You know what happened to the last bitch that ran out on me? Do you?!

Speaker: tina
Dialogue: No...

Speaker: dorian
Dialogue: Nobody else does either. Nobody ever will.

Speaker: dorian
Dialogue: Now fix yourself up, baby. And pick out something pretty to wear tonight.

Speaker: stanley
Dialogue: Milo!

Speaker: stanley
Dialogue: Come on, boy!

Speaker: stanley
Dialogue: Keys, Milo. Get the keys!

Speaker: stanley
Dialogue: Good boy...

Speaker: stanley
Dialogue: Atta boy, Milo. Now let's see if we can get out of here.

Speaker: the swede
Dialogue: So, ladies and gentlemen with a special thanks to Mayor Tilton and everyone else who made this possible, I give you... the Valhalla Casino.

Speaker: dorian
Dialogue: It's almost time.

Speaker: stanley
Dialogue: Come on.

Speaker: kellaway
Dialogue: Ipkiss!

Speaker: stanley
Dialogue: Hold it! I warn you! I'm seriously stressed out here!

Speaker: kellaway
Dialogue: Easy, Ipkiss. Don't be an idiot. You're in the middle of a police station. There's no way you're just going to walk out of here.

Speaker: stanley
Dialogue: You're right.

Speaker: kellaway
Dialogue: Now what are you doing?

Speaker: stanley
Dialogue: Putting myself in your custody.

Speaker: kellaway
Dialogue: You are certifiable.

Speaker: stanley
Dialogue: Milo!

Speaker: kellaway
Dialogue: Of course. We wouldn't want to keep Alice and the white rabbit waiting.

Speaker: stanley
Dialogue: Now move.

Speaker: doyle
Dialogue: Hi Lieutenant. Where are you taking Ipkiss?

Speaker: kellaway
Dialogue: Ixnay! Ehay's otgay an ungay... ouch!

Speaker: doyle
Dialogue: What did you say?

Speaker: charlie
Dialogue: Hello tall, Nordic and beautiful. One look at you and I know how your hat feels.

Speaker: kellaway
Dialogue: Ipkiss, I'll have you locked up for this so long sex will be safe again!

Speaker: orlando
Dialogue: We scored over half a mil from the safe!

Speaker: tina
Dialogue: Let me go you bastard!

Speaker: sweet eddy
Dialogue: All set boss.

Speaker: stanley
Dialogue: Okay. When I push the red button the safety is off, right?

Speaker: kellaway
Dialogue: I'm not helping you, Ipkiss.

Speaker: stanley
Dialogue: Alright, suit yourself.  You stay and be a good boy.

Speaker: tilton
Dialogue: Hey, watch it! Oh, Arnie...

Speaker: thug
Dialogue: Whoaaaaa!

Speaker: stanley
Dialogue: Pssst. You guys. Over here.

Speaker: charlie
Dialogue: Stanley! What are you doing here?

Speaker: stanley
Dialogue: Start sneaking people out the back. Watch out for the oil.

Speaker: swede
Dialogue: Let me offa this thing, you lousy scumbag!

Speaker: tina
Dialogue: Stanley!

Speaker: stanley
Dialogue: Hang on, Tina.

Speaker: tina
Dialogue: Stanley, look out!

Speaker: tina
Dialogue: You've got it all wrong! I could care less about this creep. Nobody could replace you, Dorian. Nobody!

Speaker: tina
Dialogue: Okay. Maybe it's too late. Then all I want is... a kiss.

Speaker: tina
Dialogue: One last kiss.

Speaker: tina
Dialogue: No! From the real Dorian. The guy I used to love.  Nobody ever kissed me like Dorian Tyrel.

Speaker: orlando
Dialogue: No time, boss. This building's going down any minute...

Speaker: dorian
Dialogue: ...to give the girl one last thrill.

Speaker: dorian
Dialogue: C'mere, you ugly little mutt...

Speaker: sweet eddy
Dialogue: Get him off me!

Speaker: orlando
Dialogue: C'mon! We've got the money. Let's get the hell out of here!

Speaker: dorian
Dialogue: I gotta have that mask!

Speaker: tina
Dialogue: You did it...

Speaker: stanley
Dialogue: Milo! Milo, come!

Speaker: tina
Dialogue: Stanley... we made it. We're alive!

Speaker: dorian
Dialogue: I'll take that.

Speaker: stanley
Dialogue: Hold it right there or you'll be looking for this on the bottom of the harbor.

Speaker: dorian
Dialogue: Drop it and I'll kill you all.

Speaker: stanley
Dialogue: You can have it. But she gets to go.

Speaker: dorian
Dialogue: Fine.

Speaker: tina
Dialogue: Go where?

Speaker: stanley
Dialogue: Swimming. We're still close to shore.

Speaker: dorian
Dialogue: Five seconds, Ipkiss.

Speaker: stanley
Dialogue: Go ahead. Hurry...

Speaker: dorian
Dialogue: Okay. Put it down. Right over there.

Speaker: tina
Dialogue: Stanley! The dynamite!

Speaker: tina
Dialogue: ...Stanley?

Speaker: stanley
Dialogue: Back to jail, Lieutenant?

Speaker: charlie
Dialogue: So I deck this thug, grab his gun and tell Stanley, "Take cover, Buddy. I'll get these folks out sae and sound." Y'know we should go back to my place so I can tell you the rest of the story.

Speaker: charlie
Dialogue: So what do you say, sweetheart? Let's you and me go back to my place and scramble some eggs.

Speaker: charlie
Dialogue: Yah! Put me down!
